1524.book: The Book on Vows and Oaths
1524.reference:
Reference  : Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1524
In-book reference  : Book 20, Hadith 1
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 18, Hadith 1524
1524.text:
Narrated 'Aishah:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "There is no vowing for disobedience, and its atonement is the atonement of an oath."

Narrated 'Aishah:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "There is no vowing for disobedience, and its atonement is the atonement of an oath."

Narrated 'Aishah:

English translation  : Vol. 3, Book 18, Hadith 1527
1527.text:
Narrated Thabit bin Adh-Dahhak:
That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "It is not for a person to vow about that over which he has no control."

Narrated Thabit bin Adh-Dahhak:

1528.book: The Book on Vows and Oaths

English translation  : Vol. 3, Book 18, Hadith 1528
1528.text:
Narrated 'Uqbah bin 'Amir:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "The atonement of a vow when it is not specified is the atonement of an oath."

Narrated 'Uqbah bin 'Amir:

1529.book: The Book on Vows and Oaths
1529.reference:
Reference  : Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1529
In-book reference  : Book 20, Hadith 7
English translation  : Vol. 3, Book 18, Hadith 1529
1529.text:
Narrated 'Abdur-Rahman bin Samurah:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "O 'Abdur-Rahman! Do not ask for a position of leadership, for if you receive it due to asking, you will be left alone with it, and if you receive it without asking, then you will be aided in it. And if you take an oath and you see that something else is better than it, then do what is better, and make an atonement for your oath."

Narrated 'Abdur-Rahman bin Samurah:

Do not ask for a position of leadership, for if you receive it due to asking, you will be left alone with it, and if you receive it without asking, then you will be aided in it. And if you take an oath and you see that something else is better than it, then do what is better, and make an atonement for your oath."

1530.book: The Book on Vows and Oaths
1530.reference:
Reference  : Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1530
In-book reference  : Book 20, Hadith 8
English translation  : Vol. 3, Book 18, Hadith 1530
1530.text:
Narrated Abu Hurairah:
That the Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Whoever takes an oath, and then he sees that something else is better than it, then he should make atonement for his oath and then do it."

Narrated Abu Hurairah:

1531.book: The Book on Vows and Oaths
1531.reference:
Reference  : Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1531
In-book reference  : Book 20, Hadith 9
English translation  : Vol. 3, Book 18, Hadith 1531
1531.text:
Narrated Ibn 'Umar:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever swears about an oath and says: 'If Allah wills (Insha Allah), then there is no breaking of the oath against him."

Narrated Ibn 'Umar:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever swears about an oath and says: 'If Allah wills (Insha Allah), then there is no breaking of the oath against him."

English translation  : Vol. 3, Book 18, Hadith 1532
1532.text:
Narrated Abu Hurairah:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever swears [about an oath] and says: 'If Allah wills (Insha Allah), then he will not have broken it."

Narrated Abu Hurairah:

1533.book: The Book on Vows and Oaths
1533.reference:
Reference  : Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1533
In-book reference  : Book 20, Hadith 11
English translation  : Vol. 3, Book 18, Hadith 1533
1533.text:
Narrated Salim:
From his father (Ibn 'Umar) that the Prophet (ﷺ) heard 'Umar saying: "By my father, By my father!" So he said: "Verily Allah prohibits you from swearing by your father." So 'Umar said: "By Allah I did not swear by him after that, neither intentionally nor in narrating."

Narrated Salim:

1534.book: The Book on Vows and Oaths
1534.reference:
Reference  : Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1534
In-book reference  : Book 20, Hadith 12
English translation  : Vol. 3, Book 18, Hadith 1534
1534.text:
Narrated Ibn 'Umar:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) came across 'Umar while he was on his mount, and he was swearing by his father. So the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Verily Allah prohibits you from swearing by your fathers. So let the one who swears, swear by Allah, or be silent."

Narrated Ibn 'Umar:

1535.book: The Book on Vows and Oaths
1535.reference:
Reference  : Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1535
In-book reference  : Book 20, Hadith 13
English translation  : Vol. 3, Book 18, Hadith 1535
1535.text:
Narrated Sa'd bin 'Ubaidah:
That Ibn 'Umar heard a man saying: "No by the Ka'bah" so Ibn 'Umar said: "Nothing is sworn by other than Allah, for I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) say: 'Whoever swears by other than Allah, he has committed disbelief or shirk.'"

Narrated Sa'd bin 'Ubaidah:

English translation  : Vol. 3, Book 18, Hadith 1536
1536.text:
Narrated Anas:
"A Woman vowed to walk to the House of Allah, so the Prophet (ﷺ) asked about that, and he said: 'Verily Allah is in no need of her walking, order her to ride.'"

1538.book: The Book on Vows and Oaths

Reference  : Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1538
In-book reference  : Book 20, Hadith 17
English translation  : Vol. 3, Book 18, Hadith 1538
1538.text:
Narrated Abu Hurairah:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Do not vow, for the vows does not prevent what is decreed at all, and it only causes the miser to spend (of his wealth)."

Narrated Abu Hurairah:

1539.book: The Book on Vows and Oaths
1539.reference:
Reference  : Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1539
In-book reference  : Book 20, Hadith 18
English translation  : Vol. 2, Book 18, Hadith 1539
1539.text:
Narrated 'Umar:
"I said:'O Messenger of Allah! I had vowed to perform I'tikaf in Al-Masjid Al-Haram for a night during the era of Jahiliyyah.' He said: 'Fulfill your vow.''"

English translation  : Vol. 3, Book 18, Hadith 1540
1540.text:
Narrated Salim bin 'Abdullah:

1541.book: The Book on Vows and Oaths
1541.reference:
Reference  : Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1541
In-book reference  : Book 20, Hadith 20
English translation  : Vol. 3, Book 18, Hadith 1541
1541.text:
Narrated Abu Hurairah:
"I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saying: 'Whoever frees a believing slave, then Allah frees a limb from the Fire for each of his limbs, such that he frees his private parts in lieu of his private parts.'"

Narrated Abu Hurairah:

English translation  : Vol. 3, Book 18, Hadith 1542
1542.text:
Narrated Suwaid bin Muqarrin Al-Muzani:
"We were seven brothers without a servant except one, and one of us slapped her, so the Prophet (ﷺ) ordered us to free her."

1543.text:
Narrated Thabit bin Adh-Dahhak:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever swears by a religion other than Islam while lying, then he is as he said."

Narrated Thabit bin Adh-Dahhak:

1544.book: The Book on Vows and Oaths
1544.reference:
Reference  : Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1544
In-book reference  : Book 20, Hadith 23
English translation  : Vol. 3, Book 18, Hadith 1544
1544.text:
Narrated 'Uqbah bin 'Amir:
"I said: 'O Messenger of Allah! My sister vowed that she would walk to the House barefoot and without Khimar (covering).' The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Verily Allah will not do anything with the misery of your sister. She should ride, and cover, and fast three days.'"

Narrated 'Uqbah bin 'Amir:

1545.book: The Book on Vows and Oaths
1545.reference:
Reference  : Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1545
In-book reference  : Book 20, Hadith 24
English translation  : Vol. 3, Book 18, Hadith 1545
1545.text:
Narrated Abu Hurairah:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever among you swears, saying in his oath: 'By Al-Lat! By Al-'Uzza!' Then let him say 'La ilaha illa Allah' And whoever says: 'Come let me gamble with you!' Then let him give in charity."

Narrated Abu Hurairah:
That the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever among you swears, saying in his oath: 'By Al-Lat! By Al-'Uzza!' Then let him say 'La ilaha illa Allah' And whoever says: 'Come let me gamble with you!' Then let him give in charity."

1546.book: The Book on Vows and Oaths
1546.reference:
Reference  : Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1546
In-book reference  : Book 20, Hadith 25
English translation  : Vol. 3, Book 18, Hadith 1546
1546.text:
Narrated Ibn 'Abbas:
That Sa'd bin 'Ubadah asked the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) about a vow that was due from his mother, who died before fulfilling it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Fulfill it for her."

Narrated Ibn 'Abbas:
That Sa'd bin 'Ubadah asked the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) about a vow that was due from his mother, who died before fulfilling it. The Prophet (ﷺ) said: "Fulfill it for her."

1547.book: The Book on Vows and Oaths
1547.reference:
Reference  : Jami` at-Tirmidhi 1547
In-book reference  : Book 20, Hadith 26
English translation  : Vol. 3, Book 18, Hadith 1547
1547.text:
Abu Umamah, and other than him from the Companions of the Prophet (ﷺ), narrated that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:
"Any Muslim man who frees a Muslim man, then it is his salvation from the Fire - each of his limbs suffices for a limb of himself. And any Muslim man that frees two Muslim women, then are his salvation from the Fire - each of their limbs suffices for a limb of himself. And any Muslim woman that frees a Muslim woman, then she is her salvation from the Fire - each of her limb suffices for a limb of herself."

Abu Umamah, and other than him from the Companions of the Prophet (ﷺ), narrated that the Prophet (ﷺ) said:
"Any Muslim man who frees a Muslim man, then it is his salvation from the Fire - each of his limbs suffices for a limb of himself. And any Muslim man that frees two Muslim women, then are his salvation from the Fire - each of their limbs suffices for a limb of himself. And any Muslim woman that frees a Muslim woman, then she is her salvation from the Fire - each of her limb suffices for a limb of herself."
